content.description: The climb is pretty consistent all the way up but the power move at the end of the arete would definitely be the crux. After moving around the corner of the arete an easy but interesting slab awaits.
content.location: This climb is located at the top of the mountain around 60 feet unter the large and only oak tree in the area. In order to get to the climb you must get to the horse trail behind the houses on Gantry Way. From the trail, it is easiest to just head directly up until spotting the boulder. From the bottom, the boulder has a distinct cub looking shape.

content.description: No real crux. Interesting start and easy finger locks at the bottom. Then climbing off jugs to the top for a cool top out on easy hand jams. Extremely easy but a very aesthetic climb.
content.location: If looking a the bottom on the horse trail. This climb is located right next to the boulder with a hole in it. Np defined trail up to the climb just bushwacking. However, the boulder is very easy to spot from the ground.
